properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 9 at 9:56AM PST until January 10 at 9:42PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
Corrected for Skokomsih River impacts.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County
Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston
Counties
Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County

There will be a relative break in widespread precipitation today
allowing rivers to continue to fall or at least slow and crest in
the case of the lower Chehalis River. The next system and cold
front Friday will bring 1 to 2 inches of precipitation. The snow
level will start off low at about 1000 feet but will rise to over
3000 feet as the precipitation comes in. With the Skokomish River
not far below flood stage by that time, there is a good chance the
storm will be enough to drive the Skokomish back up above flood
stage Friday night.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Chehalis River At Porter
* Until Friday evening.
* At  8:45 AM Thursday the stage was 48.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 48.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river is cresting now at around 49.0 feet at 7 AM
Thursday and will continue to fall to below flood stage Friday
early afternoon.
* Impact...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood
low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen
will worsen flooding along the lower reaches.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until Friday evening
